Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of Americans receiving means-tested government benefits by including entire households in the tally, even if only one person in the household receives the benefit.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the number of welfare recipients now outnumbers full-time workers.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all means-tested government benefits are welfare, without specifying the specific programs included in the count.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the data, such as the possibility that some recipients of means-tested benefits may also be full-time workers.
